titles.title: Supporting the goals and ideals of National Train Day.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Railroads, Pipelines, and Hazardous Materials.

committee.name: House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure

action.text: Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

committee.name: House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported by Voice Vote.

committee.name: House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure

action.text: Subcommittee on Railroads, Pipelines, and Hazardous Materials Discharged.

committee.name: House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure

action.text: Reported by the Committee on Transportation. H. Rept. 111-472.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 190.

action.text: Ms. Brown, Corrine moved to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution, as amended.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H. Res. 1301.

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution, as amended Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 296 - 119 (Roll no. 248).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 5/5/2010--Passed House amended. Recognizes the important contributions trains and Amtrak make to the national transportation system. Supports the goals and ideals of National Train Day as designated by Amtrak. Urges the people of the United States to recognize such a day as an opportunity to celebrate passenger rail and to learn more about trains.
